questions.question_text:
Universal Containers wants to automate a business process using workflow. They are aware that workflow rules may cause recursive behavior, and as a result certain actions will only cause workflow rules that didn't fire previously to be retriggered.
What workflow action might cause this behavior? (Choose two.)

choices.C: Workflow Outbound Messages with the "Protected Component" field selected.
choices.D: Workflow E-mails containing hard-coded links with Salesforce IDs referencing specific workflow rules.
choices.A: Workflow Field updates with the "Re-evaluate Workflow Rules After Field Change" field selected.
choices.B: Workflow Tasks where the "Due Date" field is set to "Rule Trigger Date" minus X Days.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AB
A is correct.
"Only workflow rules that didn’t fire before are retriggered."

Selected Answer: AB
A,B
Make sure that your workflow rules aren’t set up to create recursive loops. For example, if a field update for Rule1 triggers Rule2, and a field update for Rule2 triggers Rule1, the recursive triggers may cause your organization to exceed its limit for workflow time triggers per hour.
https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=sf.workflow_field_updates_reevalute_wf.htm&type=5

Selected Answer: BD
Option A, re evaluate codition is no where seen in workflow.

B & D is the answer

comments.content: Copied directly from this option on a workflow rule in Salesforce: If this field update changes the field's value, all workflow rules on the associated object are re-evaluated. Any workflow rules whose criteria are met as a result of the field update will be triggered. A is for sure correct.

discussion.content: I am confused with this question can some post the correct answer from salesforce?

comments.content: I think A and B is corrected answers about this question.

discussion.content: Can anybody post correct answer please
The only option is to set the Due Date based on either the "Rule Trigger Date" or a Date field in the Object; plus/minus "X" amount of days

This is a straightforward way to provide relevant resources in the context of the record they are working on.

questions.question_text:
Cloud Kicks works on an annual subscription model. When a sales rep marks an opportunity as closed won, a new opportunity should automatically be created for the renewal. The contracts team works outside of Salesforce but also needs to be notified about closed deals in order to initiate the contract process with the customer.

Which automation solution would meet these requirements?

discussion.content:
This question is outdated. Process builder and Workflow are no longer an option as Salsforce today does not allow the creation of new processes with these tools anymore.
Apex is the only in-Salesforce option that is possible, but AppExchange could be a better alternative in some cases, as tools like rollup helper exist which can achieve this easily.

I don't think Apex can be considered as a Automation Solution. I think here they are expecting something like a No Code. Also AppExchange can't be used here as We have 2 new fields on Objects which have to be populated. Dashboards will create new formula fields but cant assign value to existing Object record fields. So Workflows/Process Builder should be the solution. If this question is going to be asked in near future then options will have Flows in the options

Selected Answer: BD
Why is not AppExchange and Apex? 
The inclusion of AppExchange in the options, to me, suggests that the app builder needs to explore third-party apps or tools available on the AppExchange for automation, including reporting and analytics tools. AppExchange doesn't directly provide an out-of-the-box solution but might guide the app builder to search for suitable tools that meet the specific reporting requirements.
Salesforce started the process of moving away from Workflow Rules and Process Builder. In fact, PB will no longer get support in 2023 (Which is almost over). No need to consider either to solve this problem. 

The only issue I have with the question is why Salesforce did not include "Flow" in the options. 
My choices are BD

Selected Answer: CD
Workflow shouldnt be used at all as its deprecated. Apex is a natural thing and Process Builder can be used as well. This question seems old as its missing Flow as an option
